title: House Republican Anti-Abortion Bill Falls Through
teaser: A bill initially planned for a vote today fell through last night, when women Republicans objected to rape exception language.
contentencoded:
Today is the 42nd anniversary of Roe v. Wade, the Supreme Court decision guaranteeing a woman’s right to an abortion.Â Thousands of anti-abortion activists have gathered in Washington for an anti-Roe v. Wade demonstration.

Meanwhile, House Republicans are proposing legislation to chip away at abortion rights, but a bill initially planned for a vote today fell through last night, when women Republicans objected to rape exception language.

Rick Klein, political director of ABC News, joins Here & Now’s Robin Young with details.

Guest

  • Rick Klein, political director for ABC News. He tweets @rickklein.
